entry.title: Crypto Lender Hodlnaut Granted Judicial Management to Organize Restructure
entry.summary: Singapore granting Hodlnaut judicial management gives the troubled crypto lender more time to prepare for its recovery plan.

entry.title: Lido Finance Leads DeFi Rally as Ethereum Mounts Recovery
entry.summary: Blue-chip DeFi tokens, including Lido and Compound, posted hefty gains as Ethereum’s merge event fast approaches.

entry.title: FBI Issues Warning Over Vulnerable DeFi Platforms
entry.summary: The agency outlined three attack vectors, citing the $1.3 billion in digital assets stolen in Q1 2022.

entry.title: Argentine Province Allows Millions to Pay Taxes Using Stablecoins
entry.summary: Inhabitants of Mendoza can now pay for government services in USDT or DAI.

entry.title: Eminem, Snoop Dogg Bored Apes at VMAs Get Jeers From NFT Critics
entry.summary: The exclusive JPEG collection hit the mainstream with more projects on the way.

entry.title: CME Adds Euro-Denominated Ethereum Futures as Merge Approaches
entry.summary: The world’s largest derivatives exchange has launched another cryptocurrency product.

entry.title: Kevin Rose’s Proof: From NFT Drop to Growing Web3 Biz, With a CC0 Twist
entry.summary: The massive Moonbirds launch catapulted the Proof Collective to new heights, but a recent move has proven controversial.

entry.title: DeGods Have Ascended: Solana NFT Project Soars Ahead of Buzzy y00ts Launch
entry.summary: With celebrities amping up the y00ts NFT hype, the team's current DeGods collection hits an all-time high price in SOL.

entry.title: Meta Adds Ethereum, Polygon, Flow NFT Cross-Posting Between Facebook and Instagram
entry.summary: The latest enhancement is a part of Meta’s ongoing push for “interoperability” in the metaverse.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Says FTX Will Not Buy Huobi Global
entry.summary: Rumors earlier this month claimed FTX would buy crypto exchange Huobi Global, but SBF says it's not happening.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Funds Post Second-Lowest Weekly Trading Volume This Year: Report
entry.summary: Although volume usually lags this time of year, CoinShares believes the low activity "highlights continued apathy" among institutional investors.

entry.title: GammaX Raises $4M to Launch Crypto Derivatives Exchange on Ethereum Layer-2 Solution
entry.summary: The new derivatives trading platform aims to combine core features of a DEX with elements of centralized cryptocurrency exchange.

entry.title: Investors 'Irrationally Oblivious' to Crypto Trading Risks: Singapore's Financial Regulator
entry.summary: In hopes of limiting high risk in the crypto sector, Singapore is looking to make it more difficult for retail investors to join the market.

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Drop as Traditional Markets Skid into New Week
entry.summary: Several cryptocurrencies fall 3% on Sunday, revisiting lows not seen in more than a month.

entry.title: From Silk Road to NFTs: Why Musician and Artist Tycho Sees Web3 as the ‘Endgame’
entry.summary: The Grammy-nominated artist believes crypto will soon become “the norm.”

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Did Israeli Regulators Know How Insolvent Celsius Was? And Did Bitboy Really Let Atozy Off the Hook?
entry.summary: Also, Web3 CEO Maggie Love asks just how decentralized Ethereum is if Amazon hosts most of the network’s nodes.

entry.title: The FBI's Newest Podcast Subject? The Crypto Queen on the Run
entry.summary: The founder of the fake OneCoin hasn't been seen since 2017, and made the FBI's Most Wanted List with a $100,000 reward.

entry.title: From Silk Road to Buying ETH: How Musician Tycho Went Crypto
entry.summary: Scott Hansen aka Tycho, the musician, producer, and songwriter, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin how he caught the crypto bug and why he believes Web3 can change the music industry for the better.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin, Ethereum Sink on Freaky Fed Friday
entry.summary: The week was relatively quiet in terms of market-moving news—until Fed Chair Jay Powell took the podium in Jackson Hole.

entry.title: After $177 Billion in Investment, Why Do Metaverse Graphics Still Suck?
entry.summary: The metaverse has been touted as the place where we’ll spend our lives in the future—but the visuals still leave a lot to be desired.

entry.title: Bitcoin Slips Below $20,000 After Fed Chair's Comments in Jackson Hole
entry.summary: BTC and ETH fell precipitously after Fed Chair Jay Powell’s remarks in Jackson Hole on Friday.

entry.title: Coming Soon: The Cardano Hard Fork
entry.summary: Cardano Founder Charles Hoskinson says the Vasil Hard Fork is set for September. “We’re not quite over the finish line.”

entry.title: Balaji Srinivasan’s ‘Network State’ Could See Citizens Swap Passports for Ethereum Names
entry.summary: When unpacking his idea of a digital country, Srinivasan pointed to Ethereum’s domain service as a key tool for building the Network State.

entry.title: The Sheriff of Cryptoville Draws His Pistol
entry.summary: The SEC chief has gone from rhetoric to enforcement, targeting token projects from the present and past. Crypto companies are shook.

entry.title: India’s Financial Watchdog Investigates CoinSwitch Offices: Report
entry.summary: The Enforcement Directorate, India's financial crimes agency, has accused crypto exchange CoinSwitch Kuber of violating forex laws.

entry.title: How a Tribe DAO Revote Shows the Flaws in DAO Governance
entry.summary: "The tribe has spoken." That is, unless the tribe leadership overrules the initial member vote...

entry.title: Solana Now Has a Beer—With DeGods, Okay Bears and Other NFTs on the Can
entry.summary: A product of barrelDAO, Solana Summer Shandy beer features NFT avatars from the biggest projects on SOL.

entry.title: Loot, One Year Later: The NFT Hype Is Dead—But 'Lootverse' Hope Lives On
entry.summary: Lists of fantasy gear sparked a market boom (and bust), but also the imagination of builders. Loot-inspired games and media are nearing release—and a “Loot 2” NFT launch could accelerate growth.

entry.title: Coinbase Will Consider Listing Ethereum Forks Following Merge
entry.summary: The announcement from Coinbase comes as ETHW, a proposed proof-of-work Ethereum alternative, has plunged 93% in daily trading volume.

entry.title: Ethereum Nodes Largely Run on Cloud Services—This Host Says They’re Banned
entry.summary: Popular cloud service provider Hetzner hosts over 10% of Ethereum nodes—but the company says this violates its terms of service.

entry.title: Bitcoin Tanks After Powell Says Fed May Keep Raising Interest Rates
entry.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said interest rates may continue to rise in order to tame inflation, leading to a crypto market sell-off.

entry.title: Token Powering Ethereum Staking Platform Lido Finance Tumbles
entry.summary: Lido Finance’s native token has fallen amid slowing demand for staking and mixed expectations of the upcoming Ethereum merge event.

entry.title: Crypto Lending Platform Compound Rolls Out Fresh Upgrade for DeFi Users
entry.summary: The new iteration of the Compound protocol targets security, capital efficiency, and improved user experience.

entry.title: SEC Delays VanEck's Bitcoin ETF Decision Another 45 Days
entry.summary: The U.S financial regulator has again delayed the decision on VanEck's latest spot Bitcoin ETF application by 45 days.

entry.title: Miners Eye Ethereum Classic Activity as Merge Nears
entry.summary: The hash rate of ETC hits an all-time high, which reduces the risks of a "51% attack."

entry.title: Coinbase Launches Voter Registration Tool Ahead of November Elections
entry.summary: Despite a no-politics policy, the exchange is stepping in, calling the midterms “the most important in crypto’s history.”

entry.title: FTX CEO Calls Alameda VC Merger Report a 'Big Misrepresentation'
entry.summary: Sam Bankman Fried asserts that FTX and Alameda's venture investing divisions remain separate.

entry.title: Snoop Dogg and Eminem to Bring Bored Ape NFTs to VMAs In ‘Otherside’ Metaverse Performance
entry.summary: The rap legends will return to the award show after over a decade with their song “From the D to the LBC.”

entry.title: Polygon Founder Launches $50 Million Early-Stage Web3 Fund
entry.summary: Polygon’s Sandeep Nailwal and Cere Network founder Kenzi Wang have launched Symbolic Capital.

entry.title: Reddit Is Airdropping Free Polygon NFT Avatars to Its Most Hardcore Users
entry.summary: Users who have earned ample karma may be eligible to receive a free “Collectible Avatar” NFT minted on Polygon.

entry.title: How Are NFTs Stored? On-Chain, Off-Chain and Decentralized Storage
entry.summary: The data that makes up the content of NFTs needs to be stored somewhere—but not all NFT storage techniques are created equal.

entry.title: gm: Decentralized Pictures CEO on How Web3 Can Change Hollywood
entry.summary: Decentralized Pictures, the nonprofit co-founded by Roman Coppola, is enabling on-chain voting to greenlight and fund film projects. CEO Leo Matchett tells Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves how the anti-crypto stigma in Hollywood is fading, how Web3 can bring more diversity to the film world and disrupt the traditional gatekeepers, and how he first got into crypto when he and Coppola set up a Bitcoin miner in an empty sound stage.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What Is a Node?
entry.summary: In this video, we’ll learn about a core component that defines Web3: blockchain nodes. A node is one of the many computers that power a decentralized network like Ethereum. Learn about the different types of nodes and why they’re part of the core infrastructure that make Web3 possible. Visit Infura.io today to start building. Written by: Clarissa Watson, Senior Tech Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: Decrypt on the Street: An NFT Trip to Tiffany's, a Search for Status
entry.summary: In this episode of Decrypt on the Street, reporter Sander Lutz jumps through hoops in the hopes of obtaining an exclusive "NFTiff" from Tiffany & Co. Sander learns manners and spiritual awareness from two coaches, only to fall short of the digital brass ring.

entry.title: gm: Sam Bankman-Fried, Crypto Savior?
entry.summary: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is the man of the moment in crypto as he has bailed out multiple insolvent companies. Some are calling him Atlas, some sarcastically calling him savior. Sam answers tough questions from Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on FTX's bailout strategy, the controversial Voyager loan, his market outlook, marketing mistakes by crypto lenders, FTX competitors Binance and Coinbase, his political donations, and what he's learned about management.

entry.title: Why Musician and NFT Artist Jimmy Edgar Remains Skeptical on Music NFTs
entry.summary: Musician and NFT artist Jimmy Edgar is fully sold on NFT art, but not convinced yet on the uses of NFTs in the music world, he told Decrypt's Kate Irwin.

entry.title: Avalanche's John Wu Talks Institutional Interest and Use Cases
entry.summary: Ava Labs President John Wu sits for an extensive chat about institutional interest in crypto and DeFi (it has "absolutely not waned") and use cases of Avalanche with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Avalanche House in Brooklyn on July 15, 2022.

entry.title: Decrypt on the Street: Chipotle Says ‘Buy the Dip!’
entry.summary:
In our latest Decrypt on the Street segment, reporter Sander Lutz investigates Chipotle’s recent crypto marketing campaign and talks to Chipotle customers about their sadness amid the crypto crash.
Sander himself entered the contest hoping to get rich; instead he got a single cup of queso dip.

entry.title: How Civic Is Battling Web3 Bots and Spam: CPO JP Bedoya
entry.summary: Decrypt's Jason Nelson reports from NFT Expoverse in LA with JP Bedoya, Chief Product Officer at Civic, the Web3 identity verification problem rolling out a new set of tools to keep people from spamming NFT drops to take advantage.
